3.12.19  8:19 pm   favorite bill wurtz moment?

3.12.19  8:01 pm   You talk about releasing an album a lot

      but would you want to write a bunch of music and set them aside for an album or just do a retrospective best of?

      I've always wanted to release an album of music I wrote but whenever I write a half decent song I just really feel the need to release it and put it right out there for immediate gratification. I'm wondering your thoughts on whether albums are actually antiquated and what I do now, which is basically the same as what you do now, might be a better strategy.

      I suppose the situation is different if the album is a "concept album" so to speak but, you know, that would be a whole different kind of project than what I would do, personally.
3.12.19  7:56 pm   What do I do if there is something I am very interested in that I am also learning at school but school has managed to make it incredibly boring
3.12.19  7:39 pm   Might Quit features some live drumming of yours! Am I wrong?

3.12.19  7:22 pm   I mean, I knew you were a fucking great drummer but I must tell you: it feels amazing to hear you play. Have you considered uploading a drum solo/improv/play-through? Of an existing song or just like your improv videos but centered around drums? I mean, you can make it sound good with just a couple of mics and a cheap interface! Cheers!
3.12.19  7:20 pm   Hey, man! Favourite Dream Theater moment?
3.12.19  6:56 pm   how does one remedy writers block?
3.12.19  5:59 pm   Sometimes I have an idea, and one voice in my head goes, "That's a good idea," and the other voice in my head goes, "That's a terrible idea."
3.12.19  5:52 pm   Every time I start a project, I lose faith in it midway through, decide it's terrible, and scrap it. I am incapable of finishing a project. Help me, Bill.
3.12.19  5:36 pm   I find it hard to be creative when things aren't going well in my life. The idea well dries up. Any suggestions?

3.12.19  5:27 pm   I see you've changed your mind about the whole "favourite" thing.

      How did that come about?
3.12.19  4:47 pm   would you ever work on Broadway or do any traditional theatrical/musical type stuff?

3.12.19  4:31 pm   How often do you travel for work?

      You put yourself under a lot of pressure to finish songs and videos quickly, but it also sounds like you're constantly flying places. Does that travel interfere with your ability to get things done?
3.12.19  4:23 pm   Wait, questions are saying that you accidentally uploaded a video to Youtube?
3.12.19  4:17 pm   what's a nice airport terminal?
3.12.19  3:29 pm   Help am creative

3.12.19  3:27 pm   I know you mentioned previously that the time sig of "might quit" is 12/8 or 4/4, but I wanted to offer my opinion that it could be 3/4 at a fast viennese-waltz-like tempo. there would still be hypermeter stuff involved but if it was notated in 3/4 you wouldn't ever have to change the time signature to account for the extra "beats" thrown in in between verses and such

3.12.19  3:13 pm   Dude wtf how are you such a perfect human being. Like yes I know you have struggles and flaws just like everyone else, and I'm putting you on a pedestal... but from where I'm standing, god damn, bill. god damn
3.12.19  2:54 pm   the drum fills between stanzas in "might quit" are giving me so much life. thanks bill
